“What the fuck, Dani?”

Waking up the next morning hadn’t been fun. On top of the unfamiliar sensation that came with sleeping over at anyone’s house, Haley had woken up to (in order) a pounding head, a bag of complementary breakfast burritos that were starting to get cold, and the distinct impression that she’d done something a little gross the night before.

When Dani had shown her the video, it all came back to Haley in a flash of dank, cookie-filled drama.

“What happened to not everybody wants to jump your bones?”

Watching the video again, this time with sober eyes, and Haley was more than a little miffed at the implications of what she’d done. And that the pizza had been cheap, and didn’t sit right on her stomach. And that she had a headache from coughing too much…

Haley was just having a bad morning. And she was going to do everything within her power to make sure that Dani had a pretty shitty morning too.

“I didn’t jump your bones, Jesus.” Dani’s fat cheeks bounced slightly as she ate her breakfast burrito, “We made out a little bit for the camera—don’t tell me that you’ve never kissed a girl at a party before?”

Haley’s face turned a deeper shade of red as she refused to dignify Dani’s question with a response. Her anger made her sputter stupidly as the words just seemed to fail to come to her in this, the most confusing moment of her life. Waking up in a strange house with two girls who she’d never seen before and a massive pile of goth that Haley could only just barely recognize as her old friend Dani. Add into the fact that she had just… showed her the video as if it were the most ordinary thing in the world…

“Shut up!” Haley pouted, “Is that why you asked me over last night?”

“Noooooo…” Dani clicked her tongue, “I mean… not like, just that…”

“That was your chance to lie about this, you big dumb bitch!”

Dani grumbled and rolled her eyes, set deep in her marshmallow cheeks as she reclined in her seat on the couch. The gothoppotamus seemed even bigger than she did last night, when Haley was all goofed up on the Devil’s Lettuce. She looked like a pile of pillows, crammed into a t-shirt fit for a circus tent. Her fat legs splayed to either side, bean bag stomach settling nicely over the rim of the poor overtaxed sofa’s cushion. Leaning forward to talk with Haley, and making her way through her breakfast, had left her with the slightest pant to her breath.

She reached into the bag that Michelle had brought her (it paired nicely with Haley’s smaller one) and began to unwrap another burrito.

“Look, whatever, if you want to bitch about it okay, but I knew that you’d be a hit.” Dani’s singular flap of neck rippled slightly as she spoke, “So you can thank me for making you Internet Famous or you can just cunt on out of here.”

Haley was about to slap her across the speedbags that she called cheeks, but with some small struggle, Dani’s hand plunged deep into her bra. She handed Haley a crinkled, damp pair of twenties.

“That’s how much money you made me from that video last night.” Dani said in a stern voice, “You calling me fat and making out with me—rubbing my belly and shit while I eat Oreos? My fans eat it up.”

“…what the fuck, Dani?” Haley asked, looking at the money

“You were talking to me last night about how your mom was all pissed off at you and you needed to get a job, right?” Dani’s tone didn’t soften, though she didn’t seem as angry as she had been when Haley was priming herself to slap her, “Well, in for like a two-minute video you probably made enough money to buy another stupid chair.”

There was a small, deescalating pause between the two of them as Haley began to put two and two together. Holding the damp boob money in her hands, Haley held it a little closer between her fingers.

“You… do this?” Haley asked, a hint of judgement in her voice, “And you… get views? You get paid?”

“What? Is it really that hard to believe?”

Haley gave a cursory glance towards the mountain of woman piled onto the couch. Pale white, with her makeup still on from the night before, Dani wasn’t without a certain… charm (was that the right word to describe whatever it was that Dani had going on?) but it was a little hard to believe that someone like her could make money in this line of work.

"This line of work"—it sounded so seedy to think about it that way.

“Lots of people like fat chicks, Haley” Dani said with a little smirk, her hand snaking down to wobble a handful of ivory blubber overhang, “This is what pays for my share of the rent.”

As if to make a point, Dani bit deeply into her breakfast burrito. A soft belch sounded from her lips as she smacked them in satisfaction. Balling up the tinfoil, she reached into the bag and grabbed another. And then another.

“If you’re having money issues, I could help you set up your account.” Dani offered between bites, “You know, get you started. Make a few guest appearances?”

“Th…This is real.” Haley made a face, “This is a conversation that we’re having, right now.”

“Fine, fuck off then.” Dani snorted, “But don’t come crying to me when you hate your lame-ass job… if you ever fucking find one in Spartanburg-fuckin’-County.”

Haley sort of stood there, contemplating just what it was that Dani was saying. Offering. Basically telling her to do. It was true, Haley’s (minimal, basically nonexistant) efforts at finding employment hadn’t yielded anything so far. And her options were a lot more limited than she would have liked to admit. And… you know, as long as it wasn’t anything gross…

What was the harm in a little easy money?
